documents.document: I am halfway through Room and I only started it today because it is insanely intense. And I haven't seen the film.
Almost missed my bus stop because I was reading Of Mice and Men. How I've gone 26 years without reading it I have no idea.
@guywithredbeard @LukeByrne1 I second this
I saw The Pillowman in @gaiety_theatre on Saturday & it was so good. But now I want to see ALL the plays. Bye bye money!
@JackAEustace very slow to start, but gripping nonetheless
@JackAEustace just the one, I was eased in. I have the others to look forward to.
Today, I watched the Lord of the Rings. For the first time. Judge me if you will.
It's meeeee!!!! Thank you @guywithredbeard - https://t.co/i3a074jx8p has a logo now! https://t.co/XebYtiHFTZ
I went to London last weekend, saw @KinkyBootsUK & you can read my review here - https://t.co/TJ8k6xEtbt https://t.co/iCNfWXUVSR
I know I'm bored because all I want to do is get a hair cut but I know that's a bad idea because last time I cut myself a fringe & hated it.
@LukeByrne1 I think a hotel in Dublin is a cool idea? Cos it would be a nice evening but not requiring loads of time? Takes pressure off
@LukeByrne1 Book it for after she submits her final project/thesis? Or book a night in nice hotel in Dublin?
@LukeByrne1 @guywithredbeard yaaaaa! Excited. Hint: it's not all-black
@guywithredbeard @eoghanjhickey only he likes using the ginger card. No one else can
When @guywithredbeard is deadly & designs a Specky Scribbler. ðŸ‘©ðŸ»â€ðŸ«âœ’ï¸ðŸ–‹
Have started reading Do Androids Dream of Electric Sheep? And I am ENGROSSED.
I have to say, I'm kind of shocked at how many nominations La La Land got...
I have returned from London. Time to be reunited with my favourite lads. By that I mean my dogs. Obviously.
@Ryanair we're at Gate 11 since 20:15. Still not on plane & no toilet at gate & not allowed back out past security. We weren't told.
@Ryanair - in Gatwick, flight FR127 says it is delayed until 22:30 but FR119 supposedly on time? Why is 7pm flight take off after 9pm one?
In London with @Leanna_Byrne to wreck the gaff. She's tall & not blind so she can see signs in train station. V handy.
I have reviewed Anna Karenina on my blog, please read: https://t.co/MBFperH8WH https://t.co/WwOI7LvvmP
I saw La La Land yesterday. It was exactly as I expected it to be.
Plan to post blog today failed due to encountering a GP whose incompetence caused my anxious brain to be preoccupied.
After my trip to Ulysses books I'm rearranging my antique books & I have no idea where to display them while also keeping away from sun
@guywithredbeard that was so bizarre. Given that he took a photo of us being "cute".
I discovered last night playing Cards Against Humanity that I'm a much more horrible person than @guywithredbeard & it was a shock
@guywithredbeard @LukeByrne1 .... orange is not lunch
I have been reading a book on my Kindle for 2 days now and I'm both intrigued and intimidated by the "time left in book" footnote.
@LukeByrne1 you have to. Otherwise the excess crisps go to waste!
@LukeByrne1 I would imagine squidge is onomatopoeic as the sound something squishy makes. OR it is a variation of squash/squish.
@Shelly_O I should probably change my twitter handle but I'm so attached to my current one
https://t.co/n2COOOi92Q is now live! I will be writing about all of the things whilst wearing my specs. (Because I cannot see without them)
Saw Anna Karenina last night in @AbbeyTheatre and I cannot believe how amazing it was. Lisa Dwan's Anna was so visceral.
Found my dream dining room in Collins Barracks today. #history #museum @NMIreland https://t.co/fo2nOGugFO
My blog has begun. Sorry, not sorry to the one voter in my poll who said they wouldn't read it.
I got a brand new leather bound purple notebook for 2017 but it's actually so nice I'm afraid to use it for words and thoughts.
Just saw @amonstercalls and I couldn't help remembering all my Children's Lit Theory. Would recommend highly. Very important message.
Happy 2017 everyone! @VisitDublin @dublincouncil @Failte_Ireland #newyearsday #northdublin #coastaldublin https://t.co/oleZDOb9ns
@TriciaPurcell it has become you
Tonight, I'm avoiding the madness of Dublin on NYE like I have for years because I don't like crowds and I'm boring.
I am ALL OVER THIS. In the past 6 months I have found my love of reading again and I feel much better in myself. https://t.co/dxgzxPuqQj
If I start a blog will anyone read it? (I'm starting one anyway)
@RosemaryMacCabe I try not to think about it too much
And this is why I don't use ticketmaster to book things unless it is the only option. Theatre is expensive enough wâ€¦ https://t.co/hg0oMFJZk0
@Leanna_Byrne reliving the trauma of your Gaeltacht experience
Tickets to Funderland are sold by height, not by age. This seems good in theory, unless you're me and want to go on things.
@LukeByrne1 I had to manually transfer mine...
This is my first year at home on Stephen's Day in 4 years so I'm eating my weight in chocolate in my PJs while browsing the M&S sale online.
@Shelly_O so I'll be covered in glitter for the first half of 2017, but it's okay because she got me a unicorn pen & notebook too.
My Mam and I wrapped each other's presents in the same wrapping paper, so to differentiate them my Mam sprayed mine in "fairy dust"
I bought my Xmas PJs about a month ago & just now my Mam came down in hers & they are the exact same as mine. ðŸ‘¯
My Mam drove the long way home so I could catch this guy at the church in Kilbarrack. Merry Christmas! https://t.co/iU0rrWDs14
At 2am last night I sat in Rays Pizza & had the sudden urge to get PokÃ©mon Go for my iPhone. I installed it & I regret nothing.
@guywithredbeard oh I recognise that one ðŸ‘€
@LukeByrne1 you need to make sure your water is freshly boiled, i.e. not reboiled from earlier & your coffee grinds aren't too fine.
I'm 26 years of age and I got in trouble this year for opening the "tin" of Roses already.
@samwhatislife pics or it didn't happen
@LukeByrne1 never too early to eat chocolate
Pupdate: Benji has somehow managed to fashion himself a skirt https://t.co/MMSVeHicqX
Benji is not the more intelligent of the duo, but he sure does love lounging. https://t.co/jPG9zpdvF3
My Mam just got Snapchat and it's the best thing ever
The last Sunday before Christmas, I sat, smug, drinking coffee and reading because I don't like crowds and have eveâ€¦ https://t.co/QMTQSt1I0M
I'm reading Moab is my Washpot by @stephenfry & my mind is narrating it in his voice. Another wild Friday evening in the O'Connor household.
After a three month absence, I have found my journal for 2016. Sooooooo I guess that will be left 25% blank.
I'm screaming laughing at this https://t.co/1ve0FzgMQS
@LukeByrne1 back combing, hairspray and rolling between your palms
Going into Smyths was a bad idea because I have just seen 2628292722 things I want.
I nearly pulled the tree down on top of myself while decorating it, because short girl problems, but it's done now!â€¦ https://t.co/0dCIkFvD90
I walked 17km around town today. #christmas
@edmundheaphy Louis Copeland, Magee or charity shops
I know it's Christmas time when the annual fight between Mother O'Connor and the fairy lights occurs. New record this year: 45 minutes.
@LukeByrne1 like when you notice they don't have a Hailo sign and ask them about it and they tell you hailo are a shower of thieves
The Toys R Us ad just came on the TV and now I know the song will be stuck in my head for about a week. #christmas
@TriciaPurcell they are so comfy!
I'm sitting in a bay window in a seaside village reading a book. I am a clichÃ©. https://t.co/z4pnWZiM9E
I need more/new music because there is nothing anywhere except CHRISTMAS and I can't have that.
@Shelly_O This morning the Matilda book I ordered arrived too. So I am definitely full of nostalgia.
Last night I spent a good 5 minutes tumbling on crash mats because doing aerial silks required it. Childhood revisited.
I am tweeting from my new iPhone. It is SO FAST.
I bought an iPhone. I can no longer be called a Luddite. I feel like such an indulged adult
Because I am an adult, I spent Sunday at the Dingle Aquarium. This fish looks like it's saying "oh heyyyyyyyyyyyyyyâ€¦ https://t.co/7YVB2xSLV1
I have returned from the West. Dublin is loud.
I'm packed and ready for Dingle. I've essentially just brought loads of socks because my feet don't like winter.
This year is the 1st time in my living memory that I am missing the Late Late Toy Show because I'm going to @OtherVoicesLive.
I'm reading a collection of short stories by Richard Brautigan and I AM IN LOVE. Simple words put together complexly and beautifully.
@TriciaPurcell this is unacceptable
@LukeByrne1 I'm a historian by default, I only like things that are old and out of date!
I saw @arrivalmovie last night, and as someone who is obsessed with words, IT WAS SO GOOD. So much to think about re: communication methods.
Just finished Gilmore Girls and would appreciate if everyone could do the same so we can all discuss it. Thank you.
Went for a 12km walk today along Bull Island. Almost froze. Feel I'm ready for Dingle now. Acclimated.
@UnaMullally @Rubberbandits divorced women in their 60s have neither pensions nor paid off mortgages, generally.
@DanielleLouiseM @SarahKinsella35 It's cos it's a mixed bag. I think I didn't like maybe 1 or 2 pieces, but overall I thought it was great
Just saw @nocturnalanimal and it was just amazing. First time in a long time my attention was held. 10/10 would recommend
Reading about snow covered lands is making me even colder. I don't know how or why because I am essentially swaddled in blankets
@Shelly_O but the joke's on them because I could crawl into the cool secret kids' places in the Ripley's Believe It or Not in Amsterdam.
The Philips Museum in Eindhoven measured me and then told me I am the average height of a 10 year old Dutch child.
@guywithredbeard I'm so nice to you
Update re: pre-holiday concern over books - I managed to read a grand total of 50 pages over 5 days because I decided to be sociable.
Charlie barked at me for a good 2 minutes when I got home, which I'll take because normally he sulks when I leave him.
